p: RIG-I recognizes ssRNAs and transcriptional products of IAVs, which triggers activation of the caspase activation and recruitment domains (CARDs) via dephosphorylation or ubiquitination by E3 ligases, resulting in activation of transcription factors including IRFs and NF-ÎºB [ 137]. OTUB1 played an essential role in regulation of RIG-I [ 138]. In addition, melanoma differentiation-associated gene 5 (MDA5) was also involved in sensing transcriptional products of IAVs in the cytoplasm [ 139].
